Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Bonds)

Summary:  To authorize not exceeding $3,500,000 of not exceeding 20 year General Obligation Bonds of the Parish of West Feliciana for the purpose of constructing a public library building, including acquiring furniture, fixtures and equipment therefor, title to which shall be in the public, said bonds to be payable from ad valorem taxes.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of West Feliciana, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of not exceeding Three Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($3,500,000), to run not exceeding twenty (20) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate or rates not exceeding six per centum (6%) per annum, for the purpose of constructing a public library building, including acquiring furniture, fixtures and equipment therefor, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be general obligations of the Parish and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto, with an estimated one and fifteen hundredths mills (1.15) to be levied in the first year of issue to pay said bonds?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Police Jury (Mills) -- 1.5 Mills - PJ - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Millage)

Summary:  20 year, 1.5 mills property tax for improving, equipping, constructing, maintaining, operating and supporting public libraries in the Parish of West Feliciana, including the acquisition of library books, materials and equipment.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of West Feliciana, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a special tax of one and one-half (1-1/2) mills on all property subject to taxation for a period of twenty (20) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2031 (an estimated $400,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for the purpose of improving, equipping, constructing, maintaining, operating and supporting public libraries in the Parish, including the acquisition of library books, materials and equipment, said tax to replace and rededicate the one (1) mill tax authorized to be levied by the Parish through the year 2012 pursuant to an election held on November 17, 2007?
